course.name: Done is better - Build What Matters

questions.question: You do not know yet when a deliverable will be ready. What should you do?
options: Name what you do not know and when or how you will find out; say it out loud

questions.question: In this framework, how is "communicate unknowns" defined?
options: Explicitly state what you do not know yet and when you will know it
Never admit you do not know to stakeholders
Only share certainties and hide gaps

questions.question: In your next meeting or update, what could you do?
options: Name one thing you do not know yet and when or how you will find out
Promise to know soon without a date

questions.question: Faking certainty when you do not know can lead to:
options: Lost trust when reality diverges; others make plans on false assumptions

questions.question: Hiding unknowns to look in control tends to:
options: Create surprises and erode trust when the unknown becomes visible

questions.question: Why is saying "I don't know yet" leadership?
options: It sets expectations and builds trust; others can align or help

questions.question: When you learn something new about an unknown, what should you do?
options: Update and communicate; do not leave people with stale "I don't know"
